oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Gatlin Brothers Interview - Biff Collie - Tape 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with the Gatlin Brothers (performance group) conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Larry Gatlin; Steve Gatlin; Rudy Gatlin; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Larry Gatlin jokes about birth and being a very young singer -- (03:18) Gatlin brothers joke about performing in a talent contest and being brought up on stage by James Blackwood -- (06:02) Larry talks about the problem with bugs and being young performers -- (08:08) The Gatlin boys talk about taking care of a horse they won in a contest -- (11:08) The Gatlin Brothers talk about riding the horse to town because they didn't have a trailer -- (12:46) The Gatlin Brothers talk about four gospel albums and changing voices -- (15:25) Gatlin Brothers talk about going to country concerts to emulate music -- (17:41) -- The Gatlin Brothers speak on performing in separate groups and Larry's first big break with the Jimmy Dean Show -- (20:38) Larry talks about meeting Dolly West and working with her -- (21:20) Larry talks about collage golf coach asking him to sing with Steve and Rudy and singing non-gospel music together for the first time -- (24:28) Larry talks about not getting the job with the Imperials and results -- (26:31) Larry reflects on first album with Monument records and lack of success early on -- (30:55) Steve and Larry talks about recording and the eventual blossom of independent performing -- (34:18) Rudy and Steve talks on the successful string of hits, the expansion of their success, and their legendary bus -- (36:37) The Gatlin Brothers talk about their children and their golf tournament -- (40:02) Gatlin Brothers and Collie speak on behalf of drug-free rock and roll music
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Gatlin Brothers; Collie, Biff;
